title: Goa Election results 2017: Congress, BJP going neck-to-neck in Goa : Goa Assembly Election 2017, News - India Today
text:
Goa Assembly Election 2017 Goa Election results 2017: Congress, BJP going neck-to-neck in Goa Goa CM Laxmikant Parsekar has lost in Mandrem. Congress seems to be taking home the trophy for Goa Assembly election 2017. IndiaToday.in | Posted by Shreya Biswas A + A - 
While the India Today-Axis Exit Poll had predicted a convincing victory for the Bharatiya Janata Party for Goa (with 18-22 seats), Congress is giving th party a neck-to-neck competion. 
Goa CM and BJP candidate Laxmikant Parsekar lost to Congress' Dayanand Sopte in Mandrem, bringing BJP a huge loss. 
Former Goa CM and current Union Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar had led an aggressive campaign for BJP in the state, while the Aam Aadmi Party made its debut this year with former bureaucrat Evlis Gomes as its chief ministerail candidate. 
The BJP had won 21 seats in the last Assembly Elections. 
HERE ARE THE LATEST UPDATES: Five hours on, Goa Assembly Election 2017 continues to be a close tug of war between Congress and the BJP. Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat brings another win for Congress in Margao constituency, beats BJP's Sharmad Raiturkar. Babu Azgaonkar of MGP wins in Pernem. It's BJP for Sakhali constituency. Candidate Pramod Sawant decimates Congress' Dharmesh Saglani by 2131 votes. Luck takes a u-turn for Babush Monserrate in Panaji in Round three of counting, as BJP's Siddharth Kunkolienkar takes the lead with just under 300 votes. BJP Punjab mein haar rahi hai aur Goa CM apni seat se haar gaye; kya yeh Modiji ki leadership ki taraf ishara nahi hai?: Randeep Surjewala pic.twitter.com/zV8xgmDIKQ Goa forward's Jayesh Salgaokar leads in Saligao, BJP's Dilip Parulekar trails. Another win comes BJP's way in Goa as Milind Naik wins in Mormugao. BJP leader Pramod Sawant wins in Sakhali constituency, while Congress candidate Ravi Naik bags in Ponda. Former Goa CM and Congress candidate Digambar Kamat leads over BJP's Sharmad Raiturkar in Margao constituency. Babush Monserrate takes lead in Panaji in Round two of the Goa Assembly election 2017 vote-counting. In Cuncolim, Congress' Cleofasio Dias has beaten independent candidate Joaquim Alemao by 149 votes. As the second round of counting begins in Goa, Congress gets a win with Wilfred D'sa beating Goa Su-Raj Party's Francisco Pacheco in Nuvem. Counting is finally over in the first 10 constituencies. The next 10 constituencies will see an end to Goa Assembly election 2017 vote-counting soon. Someone's waving a BJP flag at the Panaji centre. The crowd boos. This doesn't sound good. #GoaElections2017 pic.twitter.com/rvFHYYLzYK - The Goan (@TheGoanEveryday) March 11, 2017 Another win for Congress in Goa: Jennifer Monserrate beats BJP's Dattaprasad Naik in Taleigao with 11534 votes. Congress (8 seats) and BJP (7 seats) are going neck-to-neck in Goa Election results 2017. Nationalist Congress Party leader Churchill Alemao wins in Benaulim, beating independent candidate Caetano Silva. That's NCP first win in Goa Assembly election 2017 race. Finally, Goa Forward Party's Vinod Paliencar comes out as the winner in Siolim with 10,189 votes. BJP man Dayanand Mandrekar loses to him with 8748 votes. Former Goa CM and Congress leader Pratapsingh Rane wins from Poriem constituency #ElectionResults pic.twitter.com/mXXebynTNZ Adding to that, Congress gets a win in Poriem constituency as Pratapsingh Rane beats BJP man Vishwajit K Rane with 14083 votes. Another win comes Congress' way as Subhash Shirodkar wins in Shiroda, beating BJP's Mahadev Naik. AAP CM candidate for Goa Elvis Gomes currently at third position in Cuncolim, Congress first, Independent second. #ElectionResults pic.twitter.com/KndXlzxN0N - ANI (@ANI_news) March 11, 2017 BJP man Michael Lobo wins by 4460 votes, keeping his seat in the Calangute constituency. Meanwhile, Goa Forward Party's Vinoda Paliencar leads ahead of BJP leader Dayanand Mandrekar by 1200 votes in Siolim. Congress leader Francis Silveira beats BJP's Ramrao Wagh in St Andre with 8878 votes. Looks like it's a good day for all 'Francises' in Goa Assembly election 2017. Here comes another victor from the Bharatiya Janta Party in Goa. BJP leader Michael Lobo has won in Calangute by 4460 votes. BJP leader Francis D'Souza wins in the Mapusa constituency with 10,957 votes. The MGP comes in second, followed by Congress. Are things beginning to look up for the Bharatiya Janta Party in Goa Assembly election 2017? Pravin Zatye wins in Mayem constituency, pulling BJP a little ahead in the Goa Assembly election 2017 race. And....independent candidate Govind Gawde wins in Priol, beating Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party's Deepak Dhavalikar. Bharatiya Janata Party leader Francis D'Souza leads with 9971 votes in Mapusa after Round 3 of Goa Assembly election 2017 vote-counting. Will BJP catch on in Goa? Congress is leading with 7 seats, followed by BJP with 5, MAG with 2, and NCP with 1. Goa Assembly election 2017 is clearly going Congress' way. Goa CM Laxmikant Parsekar has lost in Mandrem. That's an 'ouch' for the Bharatiya Janta Party in the Goa Assembly election 2017. 
via GIPHY 
Congress seems to be taking home the trophy for Goa Assembly election 2017. The party is leading in 4 seats in North Goa, followed by BJP with 2 seats. Meanwhile, Narayan Sopte leads in Mandrem, independent candidate Govind Gawde leads Priol, BJP's Pravin Zantye leads in Mayem, Jenifer Monserrat leads in Taleigao. Good news for Goa's MGP! Deepak Pauaskar of Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party has won in Savordem. Congress is leading in 3 seats, while the 'Others' is leading in one. Could this mean it's party time for Congress in Goa? Congress leaders Francisco Manuel Silveira and Vishwajit Pratap Singh Rane lead in St Andre and Valpoi respectively, as the Goa Assembly election 2017. A good day for Congress in Goa? Congress is leading in 3 seats, while the 'Others' is leading in one. Could this mean it's party time for Congress in Goa? Congress leaders Francisco Manuel Silveira and Vishwajit Pratap Singh Rane lead in St Andre and Valpoi respectively. Goa Assembly election 2017 vote-counting is on in full force in the constituencies of Taleigao, Mandrem and Poriem. Narayan Sopte leads by 750 votes after the first round of counting of the Goa Assembly election 2017. He is leading ahead of Goa CM Laxmikant Parsekar. Former Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar keeps an eye on the TV as the vote-counting of Goa Assembly election 2017 pursues. Earlier in the morning, he had performed a puja in the BJP office. A total of 1,649 electronic voting machines (EVMs) were used for the Goa Assembly election 2017. The counting of EVM votes begins. Postal ballot counting for Goa Assembly election 2017 had started at 8 in the morning. Panaji and Madgaon buzzes with energy as the Goa Assembly election vote-counting begins in full force. While Panaji is in charge of 19 seats of North Goa, Madgaon has taken up the remaining 21 South Goa seats. Vote-counting of Goa Assembly election 2017 kick starts in Panaji. District administrations are all set for the counting of Goa Assembly election 2017 votes. This year, Goa Assembly election has seen a total number of 5.63 lakh female voters and 5.45 lakh male voters. There are a total of 19 female candidates contesting. 251 candidates are contesting the election this year. Some of the crucial constituencies are Priol, Mandrem, Fatorda, Benaulim and Sanguem. Counting will begin with postal ballots at 8 AM across Goa. The incumbent government, led by BJP's Laxmikant Parsekar is fighting Congress, Aam Aadmi Party and the Shiv Sena-MGP-GSM alliance in the election. The state recorded 83 per cent polling. Polling in Goa Assembly was held on February 4 2017 in single phase.
